Nidalee and Fizz are actually interesting cases of indirect revert of reworks.

Fizz started as AP assassin, right? But he was apparently too strong, so they decided to shift his power a bit. This in turn made on-hit AS build utterly broken, because he was dealing more damage with only a third of items, allowing him to basically be two damage item bruiser.
Patch or two after he was slowly but surely nerfed out of that playstyle, effectively putting him in the same spot he was before the changes, with only two minor differences.
One, being lack of Grevious wounds and the second being lowered damage for the sake of damage amp on Ult.
Nidalee, shares the same fate, except she had at least two full rotations like this. AP->AD->AP->AD->AP
Although in her case the ultimate outcome is that she has more toxic of a kit than before with the pre-rework Kassadin tier of mobility.

We considered reverting the Elise MS nerf alongside the Runic Echoes nerf.  We decided not to because we think she will be quite strong even with changes to RE. She was viable before the item, and will likely remain so after the reduction to its movement speed.  

If it turns out we are wrong and she's suffering, I don't think we'd hesitate to put back her Movement Speed.
